{{Use dmy dates|date=January 2018}} {{Spanish name|Almirón|Rejala}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Miguel Almirón | image = 2018-08-19 - Atlanta United - Miguel Almirón.jpg | caption = Almirón with [[Atlanta United]] in 2018 | fullname = Miguel Ángel Almirón Rejala | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1994|2|10}} | birth_place = [[Asunción]], Paraguay | height = {{height|m=1.76}} | position = [[Midfielder#Attacking midfielder|Attacking midfielder]] | currentclub = [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] | clubnumber = 24 | youthyears1 = 2008–2012 | youthclubs1 = [[Cerro Porteño]] | years1 = 2013–2015 | clubs1 = [[Cerro Porteño]] | caps1 = 39 | goals1 = 6 | years2 = 2015–2016 | clubs2 = [[Club Atlético Lanús|Lanús]] | caps2 = 35 <!--League Only--> | goals2 = 3 <!--League Only--> | years3 = 2017–2019 | clubs3 = [[Atlanta United FC|Atlanta United]] | caps3 = 62 <!--MLS regular season only--> | goals3 = 21 <!--MLS regular season only--> | years4 = 2019– | clubs4 = [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] | caps4 = 4 | goals4 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2010 | nationalyears2 = 2012–2013 | nationalyears3 = 2015– | nationalteam1 = [[Paraguay men's national under-17 football team|Paraguay U17]] | nationalteam2 = [[Paraguay men's national under-20 football team|Paraguay U20]] | nationalteam3 = [[Paraguay national football team|Paraguay]] | nationalcaps1 = 10 | nationalcaps2 = 16 | nationalcaps3 = 14 | nationalgoals1 = 1 | nationalgoals2 = 2 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | medaltemplates = | club-update = 09:11, 3 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 20 November 2018 }} '''Miguel Ángel Almirón Rejala''' (born 10 February 1994) is a Paraguayan [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as an [[attacking midfielder]] for [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] and the [[Paraguay national football team|Paraguay national team]].
He began his career at [[Cerro Porteño]] and transferred to [[Club Atlético Lanús|Lanús]] in 2015. After winning the [[2016 Argentine Primera División]], he signed for [[Atlanta United FC]] for $8 million. He was named in the [[MLS Best XI]] for both of his seasons in [[Major League Soccer]], as well as [[MLS Newcomer of the Year Award|MLS Newcomer of the Year]] for 2017. After helping Atlanta to the [[MLS Cup 2018]] he signed for Newcastle for £21 million, a club record and the highest fee for an MLS player.
Almirón made his international debut for Paraguay in 2015 and represented the country at the [[Copa América Centenario]].
==Early life== Almirón grew up in an impoverished family where his father worked 18-hour shifts as a security guard and his mother worked in a supermarket. The seven members of his household slept in three bedrooms, and he had to share a bed with his mother until he was 18.<ref name=talksport/>
==Club career== Almirón began his career with [[Cerro Porteño]].
===Lanús=== In August 2015, Almirón signed for [[Club Atlético Lanús]] in the [[Argentine Primera División]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espn.com.ar/news/story/_/id/2435943/lanus-acordo-la-incorporacion-del-volante-miguel-almiron |title=Lanús acordó la incorporación del volante Miguel Almirón |publisher=ESPN |language=Spanish |date=31 July 2015}}</ref> Introduced slowly in his first season by Lanús manager [[Guillermo Barros Schelotto]], Almirón came to the forefront the next season in the shortened [[2016 Argentine Primera División]] under [[Jorge Almirón]]. Playing as an advanced central midfielder, Almirón was pivotal in Lanús' [[2016 Argentine Primera División]] title win, scoring key goals against local rivals [[Club Atlético Banfield|Banfield]] in the Clásico del Sur,<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.ole.com.ar/lanus/titulo_0_1564643549.html |title=Con personalidad |work=[[Olé (sports newspaper)|Olé]] |date=29 May 2016 |language=es}}</ref> and later in the final against [[San Lorenzo de Almagro|San Lorenzo]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1903667-san-lorenzo-lanus-torneo-transicion |title=Campeón de punta a punta: Lanús goleó a San Lorenzo 4-0 y desató la fiesta en el Monumental |work=[[La Nación]] |date=29 May 2016 |language=es}}</ref> A few months later, in August 2016, Almirón set-up the only goal in Lanús' Copa Bicentenario victory over [[Racing Club de Avellaneda|Racing]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://uk.soccerway.com/matches/2016/08/14/argentina/copa-bicentenario/racing-club-de-avellaneda/ca-lanus/2324471/ |title=Racing Club vs. Lanús 0 - 1 |work=Soccerway |date=14 August 2016 |language=en}}</ref>
===Atlanta United=== [[File:Miguel Almirón playing for Atlanta United on June 2, 2018.jpg|thumb|Almirón celebrating a goal with Atlanta United on 2 June 2018]] On 5 December 2016, Almirón signed with the new [[Major League Soccer]] expansion team [[Atlanta United FC|Atlanta United]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Almiron signs with Atlanta United|url=https://twitter.com/ATLUTD/status/805851351821459456|website=Atlanta United FC (Twitter)}}</ref> He joined as a "Young Designated Player"<ref>{{cite web|last1=Volcano|first1=Carlos|title=Atlanta United sign Paraguay international Miguel Almiron - Tribal Football|url=http://www.tribalfootball.com/articles/atlanta-united-sign-paraguay-international-miguel-almiron-4158119|website=Tribal Football}}</ref> and Atlanta paid a transfer fee of around $8 million to Lanús.<ref>{{cite web|title=Atlanta United completes signing of Paraguay star Miguel Almiron|url=http://www.espnfc.com/major-league-soccer/story/3012469/miguel-almiron-move-to-atlanta-united-nearly-done-at-$8-million-sources|website=ESPN FC}}</ref>
Almirón was an important figure in Atlanta United's first season, described as the "heartbeat" of the team by veteran teammate [[Jeff Larentowicz]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.mlssoccer.com/post/2017/09/24/atlanta-united-brace-bad-injury-news-about-heartbeat-miguel-almiron |title=Atlanta United brace for bad injury news about "heartbeat" Miguel Almiron |work=MLS Soccer |first=Payson |last=Schwin |date=24 September 2017}}</ref> On 12 March, Almirón scored his first goals for the club, notching a brace in the club's second game, a 6–1 victory over fellow MLS newcomers [[Minnesota United FC|Minnesota United]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ajc.com/sports/atlanta-united-minnesota-united-observations/wFjrmdtScuGNirW2Kt5joK/ |title=Atlanta United 6, Minnesota United 1: 5 observations |work=Atlanta Journal-Constitution |first=Doug |last=Roberson |date=13 March 2017}}</ref> He scored the second hat-trick in club history on 20 May against the [[Houston Dynamo]], and scored two goals a week later against [[New York City FC]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.mlssoccer.com/post/2017/05/21/miguel-almiron-obliges-coachs-request-shoot-more-nets-hat-trick |title=Miguel Almiron obliges coach's request to shoot more, nets a hat trick |work=MLS Soccer |first=Payson |last=Schwin |date=21 May 2017}}</ref> Almirón joined teammates [[Greg Garza]] and [[Michael Parkhurst]] in the [[2017 MLS All-Star Game|MLS All-Star Game]] on 2 August,<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.mlssoccer.com/post/2017/07/30/atlanta-united-celebrates-first-year-three-all-star-picks |title=Atlanta United celebrates first year with three All-Star picks |work=MLS Soccer |first=Payson |last=Schwin |date=30 July 2017}}</ref> and topped the league's list of 24 players under the age of 24, released on 28 September.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.atlutd.com/post/2017/09/28/miguel-almir-n-ranked-1-mls-24-under-24-list |title=Miguel Almirón ranked #1 in MLS 24 Under 24 List |work=Atlanta United |date=28 September 2017}}</ref> During the regular season, Almirón was named to seven [[2017 Major League Soccer season#Player / team of the week|Teams of the Week]] by Major League Soccer, and was named Player of the Week twice.<ref>{{cite web |last=Boehm|first=Charles|website=[[Major League Soccer]]|date=May 22, 2017|accessdate=June 5, 2018|url=https://www.mlssoccer.com/post/2017/05/22/2017-team-week-wk-12-superstars-and-men-red-shine|title=2017 Team of the Week (Wk 12): Superstars, and Men in Red, shine}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last1=Stejskal |first1=Sam |title=Miguel Almiron wins Alcatel MLS Player of the Week for Week 12 |url=https://www.mlssoccer.com/post/2017/05/23/miguel-almiron-wins-alcatel-mls-player-week-week-12 |website=[[Major League Soccer]] |accessdate=June 11, 2018 |date=May 23, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last1=Stejskal |first1=Sam |title=Miguel Almiron wins second straight Alcatel MLS Player of the Week |url=https://www.mlssoccer.com/post/2017/05/30/miguel-almiron-wins-second-straight-alcatel-mls-player-week |website=[[Major League Soccer]] |accessdate=June 11, 2018 |date=May 30, 2017}}</ref> At the end of the season, he was named to the league's Best XI<ref name="mlsbestXI17">{{cite web|title=2017 MLS Best XI revealed: Who was the best in 2017?|url=https://www.mlssoccer.com/post/2017/11/29/2017-mls-best-xi|publisher=Major League Soccer|accessdate=December 1, 2017}}</ref> and was named [[MLS Newcomer of the Year Award|Newcomer of the Year]].<ref name="mlsnewcomer">{{cite web|last=Boehm|first=Charles|url=https://www.mlssoccer.com/post/2017/11/20/atlanta-uniteds-miguel-almiron-named-2017-mls-newcomer-year|title=Atlanta United's Miguel Almiron named 2017 MLS Newcomer of the Year|website=[[Major League Soccer]]|date=November 20, 2017|accessdate=November 20, 2017}}</ref>
In April 2018, Almirón was named MLS Player of the Month for his five goals and two assists as Atlanta went unbeaten with three wins and a draw.<ref name=potm/> With 12 goals and 14 assists, he was again named in the MLS Best XI, alongside teammate [[Josef Martínez]].<ref name=2018xi/> Atlanta won [[MLS Cup 2018]] against the [[Portland Timbers]] in only their second season of existence, and Almirón was named in the Team of the [[2018 MLS Cup Playoffs]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Boehm |first1=Charles |title=Team of the Audi 2018 MLS Cup Playoffs: Who made the postseason Best XI? |url=https://www.mlssoccer.com/post/2018/12/11/team-audi-2018-mls-cup-playoffs-who-made-postseason-best-xi |accessdate=7 February 2019 |publisher=Major League Soccer |date=11 December 2018}}</ref>
===Newcastle United=== On 31 January 2019, Almirón joined [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] for an undisclosed fee on a five-and-a-half year deal.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Easterby |first1=Tom |title=Magpies complete Almirón signing |url=https://www.nufc.co.uk/news/latest-news/magpies-complete-almiron-signing |accessdate=31 January 2019 |work=Newcastle United Football Club |date=31 January 2019}}</ref> The transfer fee is believed to be around £21 million, a club record fee,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/47072107|title=Newcastle break their transfer record to sign playmaker Miguel Almiron|date=31 January 2019|publisher=|accessdate=31 January 2019|via=www.bbc.co.uk}}</ref> and a record for an MLS player.
He made his [[Premier League]] debut on 11 February in a 1–1 draw at [[Wolverhampton Wanderers]], playing the final 18 minutes in place of [[Christian Atsu]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Waugh |first1=Chris |title=Miguel Almiron debut watch: How playmaker's pace, flair and workrate whet appetite of Newcastle fans |url=https://www.chroniclelive.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/miguel-almiron-debut-wolves-newcastle-15818192 |accessdate=19 February 2019 |work=Chronicle Live |date=12 February 2019}}</ref> In jest, fans and media likened Almirón to Santiago Muñez, a fictional Newcastle player from the film [[Goal! (film)|''Goal!'']] who also moved from Latin America to [[St James' Park]] via the United States.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Edwards |first1=Luke |title=Miguel Almiron's Newcastle move is like a film plot but he will have to write his own scripts |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2019/01/31/miguel-almirons-newcastle-move-like-movie-plot-will-have-write/ |accessdate=2 March 2019 |work=The Daily Telegraph |date=31 January 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Musgroves |first1=Andrew |title=As Newcastle fans compare Miguel Almiron to Santiago Munez - here's how the Magpies won the race to film Goal |url=https://www.chroniclelive.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/revealed-how-newcastle-united-took-13365994 |accessdate=2 March 2019 |work=Chronicle Live |date=25 February 2019}}</ref><ref name=talksport>{{cite news |last1=Cole |first1=Jackson |title=Miguel Almiron says he dreams of ‘achieving something big’ with Newcastle United |url=https://talksport.com/football/490406/newcastle-miguel-almiron-dreams-achieving-something-big/ |accessdate=2 March 2019 |publisher=Talksport |date=8 February 2019}}</ref>
==International career== Almirón played for the [[Paraguay men's national under-20 football team|Paraguay under-20 national team]] in the [[2013 South American Youth Football Championship]] in Argentina, and was highly involved as his team finished second to [[Colombia national under-20 football team|Colombia]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.d10.com.py/futbol/seleccion-paraguaya/26923-convocados-para-el-suda |title=Convocados para el Suda |publisher=D10 |date=2 January 2013 |language=Spanish}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.d10.com.py/futbol/seleccion-paraguaya/28038-paraguay-es-subcampeon |title=Paraguay es subcampeón |publisher=D10 |date=4 February 2013 |language=Spanish}}</ref> Later that year, he was called up for the [[2013 FIFA U-20 World Cup]] in Turkey, where Paraguay reached the last 16.<ref>{{cite news |title=Sub 20: Convocados de Paraguay |url=http://espndeportes.espn.com/noticias/nota?s=fut&id=1816411&type=story |accessdate=7 February 2019 |publisher=ESPN |date=1 June 2013 |language=Spanish}}</ref>
On 5 September 2015, Almirón made his [[Paraguay national football team|senior international]] debut in a 3–2 friendly loss away to [[Chile national football team|Chile]], playing the final nine minutes in place of [[Jonathan Fabbro]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Chile con tanto de Alexis Sánchez venció 3-2 a Paraguay en Santiago |url=https://rpp.pe/futbol/mas-futbol/chile-con-tanto-de-alexis-sanchez-vencio-3-2-a-paraguay-en-santiago-noticia-833153 |accessdate=19 February 2019 |publisher=RPP |date=5 September 2015 |language=Spanish}}</ref> Manager [[Ramón Díaz]] called him up the following May for the [[Copa América Centenario]] in the United States, where he started two matches in a group-stage exit.<ref>{{cite news |title=Paraguay reveals Copa America Centenario final roster |url=https://www.si.com/planet-futbol/2016/05/09/paraguay-copa-america-centenario-roster |accessdate=19 February 2019 |work=Sports Illustrated |date=9 May 2016}}</ref>
